column4: how do I select which locale I want to compile if /etc/locale.gen file is missing on ubuntu?
install and configure the package localeconf. i have no idea why they diverged from the debian way of doing it...
thanks
localeconf installed and configured to use debconf.. any more hints pls?
dpkg-reconfigure localeconf
it gives me the same configuration windows I had during instalation. Aksing if I want to use debconf to manage
oh, either something changed or i'm wrong. please try dpkg-reconfigure locales. but i think reconfiguring localeconf did the trick
it seems that dpkg-reconfigure locales just trigers locale-gen command and generate previous locales but I ned to add more :-)
yeah, i know what you mean. installing localeconf shoud do the trick. but it does not. sorry - no more ideas. the ubutu devs splitted the locale package in two some time ago
did you answered affrimatively the debconf question in localeconf?
yes I did .. do I want to use debconf ?
yes
maybe look in /usr/share/doc/localeconf for help. i really have no more ideas
Replace existing locale configuration files?
i don't understand your last question
that was from localeconf configuration. Now it works... I needed to answer yes for debconf and yes toReplace existing locale configuration files
oh, glad that it works now
thanks man but I still think that this is not all I need..:-( this is asking me for default locale
and it does not offer you a list of possible locales to install? it should
NO :-) it was so simple in debian and they say that ubuntu is user friendly !! :-)
yep. but i'm not able to help you further because i use debian proper
thanks anyway..
np man :-)
